title: What were the dangers perceived by Esdaile in Mesmerism, and how did he use gaze in his experiments?
first_phrase: This article explores the dangers of Mesmerism, a practice that involves inducing a hypnotic state in someone. The author discusses the views of medical man, Esdaile, who believed that Mesmerism was only safe when used for medical purposes. Esdaile acknowledged the risks associated with Mesmerism, such as the potential for shock and falling spontaneously into the Mesmeric state. Additionally, the author discusses how Esdaile used the technique of "gazing" to Mesmerize his patients and its powerful effects. This last section focuses on Esdaile's experiments to determine the distance at which the technique would be effective.
